Knitters leave a bit of yarn sticking out of the day’s day ’s knitting so they know where to pick up the next day — they call it the “ hint . ”
Potters leave a rough edge on the
Potters leave a rough edge on the wet clay before they wrap it in plastic
Potters leave a rough edge on the wet clay before they wrap it in plastic for the night — it’s it ’s hard to build on a smooth edge.
Forget advice about finding the right atmosphere
Forget advice about finding the right atmosphere to coax your muse into the room.
Forget candles, music, silence, a good chair
Forget candles, music, silence, a good chair, a cigarette, or putting the kids to sleep.
It’s It ’s nice to have all your physical needs met before you
It’s It ’s nice to have all your physical needs met before you write, but if you convince yourself that you can only write in

It’s It ’s nice to have all your physical needs met before you write, but if you convince yourself that you can only write in a perfect world, you compound the problem of finding 20 free minutes with the problem of finding the right environment at the same time.
When the time is available, just
When the time is available, just put fingers to keyboard and write.
You can put up with noise / silence /
You can put up with noise / silence / kids / discomfort / hunger for 20 minutes.
The biggest impediment to concentration is
The biggest impediment to concentration is your computer’s computer ’s ecosystem of interruption
The biggest impediment to concentration is your computer’s computer ’s ecosystem of interruption technologies: IM, email alerts, RSS alerts, Skype rings, etc.
Anything that requires you to wait for a
Anything that requires you to wait for a response, even subconsciously, occupies your attention.
Anything that leaps up on your screen to
Anything that leaps up on your screen to announce something new, occupies your attention.
The more you can train your friends and family to use
The more you can train your friends and family to use email, message boards, and similar technologies that allow you

The more you can train your friends and family to use email, message boards, and similar technologies that allow you to save up your conversation for planned sessions instead of demanding your attention right now helps you carve out your 20 minutes.
By all means, schedule a chat
By all means, schedule a chat — voice, text, or video
By all means, schedule a chat — voice, text, or video — when it’s it ’s needed, but leaving your IM running is like sitting

By all means, schedule a chat — voice, text, or video — when it’s it ’s needed, but leaving your IM running is like sitting down to work after hanging a giant “ DISTRACT ME ” sign over your desk, one that shines brightly enough to be seen by the entire world.
I don’t do n’t claim to have
I don’t do n’t claim to have invented these techniques, but they’re they
I don’t do n’t claim to have invented these techniques, but they’re they ’re the ones that have made the 21st century a good one for me.
10: How to Save the Middle Class
10: How to Save the Middle Class When Jobs Don’t Do n’t Pay (Barnes)
Photo by Laity Lodge Family Camp under a CC license.
There’s There ’s long been a notion
There’s There ’s long been a notion that, because money is a prerequisite for
There’s There ’s long been a notion that, because money is a prerequisite for survival and security, everyone should be assured some income just for being alive.
The notion has been advanced by liberals such
The notion has been advanced by liberals such as James Tobin, John Kenneth Galbraith, and
The notion has been advanced by liberals such as James Tobin, John Kenneth Galbraith, and George McGovern, and by conservatives like Friedrich Hayek, Milton Friedman, and Richard Nixon.
It’s It ’s embedded in the board game Monopoly, in
It’s It ’s embedded in the board game Monopoly, in which all players get equal payments when they pass Go.
And yet, with one exception, Americans have been unable
And yet, with one exception, Americans have been unable to agree on any plan that guarantees some income to everyone.
The reasons lie mostly in the
The reasons lie mostly in the stories that surround such income.
Does it require higher taxes and bigger government?
Americans think dimly of all these things.
But then, there’s there ’s the exception.
Jay Hammond, the Republican governor of Alaska from 1974 to
Jay Hammond, the Republican governor of Alaska from 1974 to 1982, was an independent thinker who conceived of, and

Jay Hammond, the Republican governor of Alaska from 1974 to 1982, was an independent thinker who conceived of, and then persuaded Alaska’s Alaska ’s legislators to adopt, the world’s world ’s first system for paying equal dividends to everyone.
In Hammond’s Hammond ’s model, the money comes not from
In Hammond’s Hammond ’s model, the money comes not from taxes but from a common resource: North Slope oil.
Using proceeds from that gift of nature,
Using proceeds from that gift of nature, the Alaska Permanent Fund has paid equal yearly dividends
Using proceeds from that gift of nature, the Alaska Permanent Fund has paid equal yearly dividends to every resident, including children, ranging from about $1,000 to over $3,000.
(Bear in mind that a family of
(Bear in mind that a family of four collects four same - sized dividends.)
While this isn’t is n’t enough to live on
While this isn’t is n’t enough to live on, it nicely supplements Alaskans’ Alaskans ’ other earnings.
And paying such dividends regularly for more than
And paying such dividends regularly for more than thirty years has bolstered the state’s state ’s
And paying such dividends regularly for more than thirty years has bolstered the state’s state ’s economy, reduced poverty, and made Alaska one of the least unequal states in America.
The question Americans in the lower 48 should now
The question Americans in the lower 48 should now ask is: Did Alaska find the right formula?
If it can convert part of
If it can convert part of its common wealth into equal dividends for
If it can convert part of its common wealth into equal dividends for everyone, can the rest of America do the same? [...]
How might a common wealth dividend
How might a common wealth dividend system work at the national level?
The easy part is distributing the dividends.
As in Alaska, enrollment could be done online and payments
As in Alaska, enrollment could be done online and payments could wired electronically at a cost of pennies per transaction.
The Social Security Administration could set
The Social Security Administration could set that up in a jiffy.
The harder part is collecting the revenue.
In my latest book, With Liberty and Dividends
In my latest book, With Liberty and Dividends For All, I show how, over time
In my latest book, With Liberty and Dividends For All, I show how, over time, we could generate enough revenue to pay dividends of up to $5,000 per person per year.
Initially, a sizable chunk would come from selling a
Initially, a sizable chunk would come from selling a declining number of permits to dump carbon into our air.
Later, more revenue could flow from our monetary infrastructure,
Later, more revenue could flow from our monetary infrastructure, our patent and copyright systems, and our electromagnetic airwaves.
Consider what $5,000 per person per year would mean.
If a child’s child ’s dividends were saved
If a child’s child ’s dividends were saved and invested starting from birth, they’d they
If a child’s child ’s dividends were saved and invested starting from birth, they’d they ’d yield enough to pay for a debt - free college education at a public university.
In midlife, $5,000 per person would add 25 percent to
In midlife, $5,000 per person would add 25 percent to the income of a family of four earning $80,000 a year.
In late life, it would boost the average retiree’s
In late life, it would boost the average retiree’s retiree ’s Social Security benefit by about 30 percent.
Thus, dividends from common wealth would provide
Thus, dividends from common wealth would provide a badly - needed boost for poor and
Thus, dividends from common wealth would provide a badly - needed boost for poor and middle class families during what promises to be a lasting shortage of good - paying jobs.
Surprisingly, the core idea behind Alaska’s Alaska
Surprisingly, the core idea behind Alaska’s Alaska ’s dividends is over two centuries old.
In his 1796 essay “ Agrarian Justice, ” American patriot Thomas Paine distinguished between
In his 1796 essay “ Agrarian Justice, ” American patriot Thomas Paine distinguished between two kinds of property: “ natural property, or that which comes to us

In his 1796 essay “ Agrarian Justice, ” American patriot Thomas Paine distinguished between two kinds of property: “ natural property, or that which comes to us from the Creator of the universe--such as the earth, air, water … [and] artificial or acquired property, the invention of men . ”
The second kind of property, Paine argued, must necessarily be
The second kind of property, Paine argued, must necessarily be distributed unequally, but the first kind belongs to everyone equally.
It is the “ legitimate birthright ” of every man
It is the “ legitimate birthright ” of every man and woman, “ not charity but a right . ”
He proposed a practical way to
He proposed a practical way to implement that right: create a “
He proposed a practical way to implement that right: create a “ National Fund ” to pay every man and woman a lump sum (roughly

He proposed a practical way to implement that right: create a “ National Fund ” to pay every man and woman a lump sum (roughly $17,000 in today’s today ’s money) at age twenty - one, and pay a stipend of about $1,000 a month after age fiftyfive.
Revenue would come from what Paine called
Revenue would come from what Paine called “ ground rent ” paid by landowners.
He even showed mathematically how this could work.
Presciently, Paine recognized that land, air, and water could be monetized
Presciently, Paine recognized that land, air, and water could be monetized not just for the benefit of a few but for the good of all.
Further, he saw that this could
Further, he saw that this could be done at a national level.
This was a remarkable feat of analysis and imagination,
This was a remarkable feat of analysis and imagination, and it’s it ’s time to apply it broadly.
Today, Paine’s Paine ’s core idea — that
Today, Paine’s Paine ’s core idea — that everyone has a right to equal income from common
Today, Paine’s Paine ’s core idea — that everyone has a right to equal income from common wealth — can be applied not just to natural resources but also to the creations of society.
Consider, for example, the immense value created by our legal, intellectual
Consider, for example, the immense value created by our legal, intellectual, and financial infrastructures, the Internet, and our economy as a whole.
This value isn’t is n’t created
This value isn’t is n’t created by single individuals or corporations;
This value isn’t is n’t created by single individuals or corporations; it’s it ’s created collectively and hence belongs equally to all.
In a fairer economy some of it
In a fairer economy some of it would actually be distributed to all.
The ideal mechanism for doing this would be
The ideal mechanism for doing this would be common wealth dividends — simple, transparent, direct
The ideal mechanism for doing this would be common wealth dividends — simple, transparent, direct (not trickle down), built on co-ownership rather than redistribution, and politically appealing.
And here’s here ’s the best part.
If Paine’s Paine ’s idea and Alaska’s Alaska ’s model were
If Paine’s Paine ’s idea and Alaska’s Alaska ’s model were applied at sufficient scale, the implications would be vast.
The current tendencies of capitalism to widen inequality
The current tendencies of capitalism to widen inequality and devour nature would be self - corrected.
Instead of plutocracy and climate change, our market economy
Instead of plutocracy and climate change, our market economy would generate widely - shared, earth - friendly prosperity.
And it would achieve these goals automatically
And it would achieve these goals automatically, without much need for government intervention.
Possibly, but no more so than
Possibly, but no more so than universal suffrage or Social Security once were.
Common wealth dividends could be the next step
Common wealth dividends could be the next step in America’s America ’s long march toward equal
Common wealth dividends could be the next step in America’s America ’s long march toward equal rights — and the game - changer that leads to a new version of capitalism.
But first, we have to see the opportunity and demand it.
28: Why Sex Gets Better in Older
28: Why Sex Gets Better in Older Age (Forbes, Eaton, and Krueger)
By Miri Forbes, Nicholas Eaton, and Robert Krueger
" Old Couple " by Ian MacKenzie is licensed under CC BY 2.0
Aging is generally associated with improvements in our
Aging is generally associated with improvements in our quality of life: We become more proficient in
Aging is generally associated with improvements in our quality of life: We become more proficient in our work, learn how to manage our finances better and our bonds with loved ones deepen.
With time and practice, most of
With time and practice, most of the core domains of our lives improve
With time and practice, most of the core domains of our lives improve as we develop skills and strategies to manage our lives with more mastery.
An exception to this pattern is the quality of our sex
An exception to this pattern is the quality of our sex lives, which has consistently been reported to deteriorate with age.
While this fits with the messages we receive from popular culture
While this fits with the messages we receive from popular culture, which tell us that sex is a young person's person's

While this fits with the messages we receive from popular culture, which tell us that sex is a young person's person's domain, it is somewhat at odds with the fact that older adults continue to explore and enjoy sexuality well into old age.
The majority of men and women over 60 in
The majority of men and women over 60 in the U.S. are sexually active, most are sexually
The majority of men and women over 60 in the U.S. are sexually active, most are sexually active at least two to three times per month (more often than many younger adults).
They also rate sex as an important part of life.
So, if there is no epidemic of age - related frigidity,
So, if there is no epidemic of age - related frigidity, why would sexual quality of life take a nosedive in later life?
A common answer to this question cites declining
A common answer to this question cites declining physical health and sexual functioning with age.
Another answer might be: The quality of our
Another answer might be: The quality of our sex lives doesn't doesn't decline with age.
There is a key element missing from nearly all studies
There is a key element missing from nearly all studies of sex and aging: studying change over time.
If we ask a group of people how satisfied
If we ask a group of people how satisfied they are with their sex life, and the younger
If we ask a group of people how satisfied they are with their sex life, and the younger people are more satisfied than the older people, does that mean that aging is responsible for this difference?
What if instead the apparent age difference is
What if instead the apparent age difference is because people born in the 1930s have different attitudes
What if instead the apparent age difference is because people born in the 1930s have different attitudes toward sex than people who grew up after the sexual revolution of the '60's and '70's?
To get to the bottom of how aging affects
To get to the bottom of how aging affects sexual quality of life, we analyzed patterns in longitudinal

To get to the bottom of how aging affects sexual quality of life, we analyzed patterns in longitudinal data collected from over 6,000 individuals followed over a period of 18 years, spanning ages 20 - 93.
In 1995, 2004 and 2013, the representative sample of English - speaking Americans
In 1995, 2004 and 2013, the representative sample of English - speaking Americans completed extensive self - administered survey questionnaires in private and returned them by mail.
A key question for our study was: How
A key question for our study was: How would you rate the sexual aspects of your life these
A key question for our study was: How would you rate the sexual aspects of your life these days, from the worst possible situation (0) to the best possible situation (10)?
The basic trends in the data
The basic trends in the data suggested that - without taking any
The basic trends in the data suggested that - without taking any other factors into account sexual quality of life declines with age.
But as people in the study aged, they placed more
But as people in the study aged, they placed more emphasis on the quality - not quantity - of sexual encounters.
For example, frequency of sex became less important with age, and
For example, frequency of sex became less important with age, and the amount of thought and effort invested in sex became more important.
These changing priorities were key predictors of sexual quality of life
These changing priorities were key predictors of sexual quality of life for older adults, and appeared to buffer its decline.
When we matched older and younger adults on key
When we matched older and younger adults on key characteristics of their sex lives - along with sociodemographic

When we matched older and younger adults on key characteristics of their sex lives - along with sociodemographic characteristics, and mental and physical health - older adults actually had better sexual quality of life.
For example, if we compared a 40 - year
For example, if we compared a 40 - year - old man and a 50 - year - old
For example, if we compared a 40 - year - old man and a 50 - year - old man with the same levels of perceived control over their sex life, who invest the same amount of thought and

For example, if we compared a 40 - year - old man and a 50 - year - old man with the same levels of perceived control over their sex life, who invest the same amount of thought and effort in their sex life, have sex with the same frequency and had the same number of sexual partners in the past year, we would expect the 50 - year - old to report better sexual quality of life.
This is consistent with the improvement we see in other
This is consistent with the improvement we see in other life domains with age, and highlights the benefits of

This is consistent with the improvement we see in other life domains with age, and highlights the benefits of life experience for sexuality as people learn more about their sexual preferences and their partners' partners' likes and dislikes.
The positive relationship between sexual quality of life and aging
The positive relationship between sexual quality of life and aging was strongest in the context of good - quality romantic

The positive relationship between sexual quality of life and aging was strongest in the context of good - quality romantic relationships, where sexual exploration and a focus on partners' partners' pleasure is more likely to take place.
Life experience related to a better sex life
Together these findings suggest that as we age
Together these findings suggest that as we age, our sexual priorities change and we develop knowledge
Together these findings suggest that as we age, our sexual priorities change and we develop knowledge, skills and preferences that protect against aging - related declines in sexual quality of life.
Since wisdom is " the quality of having experience, knowledge and good
Since wisdom is " the quality of having experience, knowledge and good judgment, " our study suggests that life experience is fostering sexual wisdom.
This is great news, as a satisfying sex life has been found
This is great news, as a satisfying sex life has been found to be important for health and well - being, regardless of age.
For older adults in particular, being sexually
For older adults in particular, being sexually active predicts a longer and healthier life.
We now know that age - related declines
We now know that age - related declines in sexual quality of life are largely related to
We now know that age - related declines in sexual quality of life are largely related to modifiable factors, so we can target sexual skills, beliefs and attitudes in clinical interventions.
Given that our life expectancy continues to grow, this research
Given that our life expectancy continues to grow, this research highlights the opportunity to facilitate positive sexual experiences across the lifespan.

By adding certain chemicals, the ROS can be measured using the emission of light of a certain wave - length.
The detrimental effect of ROS on
The detrimental effect of ROS on spores was easy to measure.
We mixed different concentrations of ROS
We mixed different concentrations of ROS with the spores, plated them out
We mixed different concentrations of ROS with the spores, plated them out on petri dishes with an agar - solution where fungus can grow on.
A day after, we counted how many spores were still alive.
How reliable do you consider your results to be?
The results we got are very reliable.
We had a lot of colonies containing a lot of
We had a lot of colonies containing a lot of ants, and wherever possible we conducted the experiment blind.
This means the experimenter doesn't doesn't
This means the experimenter doesn't doesn't know which ants belong to which treatment,
This means the experimenter doesn't doesn't know which ants belong to which treatment, so it's it's impossible to influence the results with' observer bias'.
However, of course this is proof in just one species.
It is hard to extrapolate to other ants
It is hard to extrapolate to other ants, as different species lead very different lives.

Jack Herrick, wikiHow founder interviewed by Wikinews
wikiHow is a wiki - based site which aims to " build the
wikiHow is a wiki - based site which aims to " build the world's world's largest, highest quality how - to manual . "
It recently published its 50,000th article, and to discuss what the site has achieved
It recently published its 50,000th article, and to discuss what the site has achieved since its creation, Wikinews interviewed the site's site's founder, Jack Herrick.
In the interview, Herrick explains what wikiHow is,
In the interview, Herrick explains what wikiHow is, why he decided to create it, how he grew
In the interview, Herrick explains what wikiHow is, why he decided to create it, how he grew it in size, and why he chose to use a Creative Commons license (HyperLink) for his site.
Read below for more of the interview in full.
For our readers who are unaware of your site
For our readers who are unaware of your site, could you briefly explain what wikiHow is?
wikiHow is a collaborative effort to build the world's world
wikiHow is a collaborative effort to build the world's world's largest, highest quality how - to manual.
Our long term goal is to produce practical
Our long term goal is to produce practical instructions on almost every topic in every language.
We're We're quite far from our goals currently, but we take
We're We're quite far from our goals currently, but we take comfort in the fact that every month wikiHow gets noticeably better and larger
We currently have just under 50000 articles and over 1000 featured articles.
We hope that in time, we will have millions
We hope that in time, we will have millions of articles with many of them having featured status.
That said, we are realistic enough to realize
That said, we are realistic enough to realize that this goal will take decades to achieve.
However, in terms of readership, we are
However, in terms of readership, we are probably the most popular single subject wiki after Wikipedia.
We get over 14 million unique visitors
We get over 14 million unique visitors per month (source: Google Analytics
We get over 14 million unique visitors per month (source: Google Analytics), which makes us the 135th most popular site according to Quantcast.
[Note: The interview took place just before the 50000 milestone was met]
Like Wikipedia, wikiHow is a wiki that runs on Mediawiki software.
Our community is full of volunteers
Our community is full of volunteers from all over the world.
That said, we are quite different from Wikipedia in several respects:
The English wikiHow has only 60 admins,
The English wikiHow has only 60 admins, compared to the 1000 + on English Wikipedia.
As a result, wikiHow is still at the size
As a result, wikiHow is still at the size that every editor eventually gets to know other editors.
We are run as a Hybrid Organization - a
We are run as a Hybrid Organization - a for-profit company focused on achieving a social good.
This has several advantages and disadvantages when compared
This has several advantages and disadvantages when compared to the non-profit structure at the Wikimedia Foundation.
We show opt - out advertising to
We show opt - out advertising to anonymous visitors rather than ask for donations.
Our advertising revenue funds community meetups
Our advertising revenue funds community meetups and has even allowed us to donate
Our advertising revenue funds community meetups and has even allowed us to donate over $60,000 to charities such as the Wikimedia Foundation and Creative Commons.
In addition, we've we've used our revenue on
In addition, we've we've used our revenue on things like buying carbon offsets to become carbon neutral.
Our community culture is focused on wikiLove and civility.
As a result some folks believe wikiHow is a more
As a result some folks believe wikiHow is a more humane and enjoyable place to work than other places online.
Why did you decide to create wikiHow?
I think that providing people with a practical education is one
I think that providing people with a practical education is one of the most empowering things you can offer a person.
Imagine having detailed step - by - step instructions
Imagine having detailed step - by - step instructions on how to do any activity you could imagine.
How much more could you accomplish as an
How much more could you accomplish as an individual if you could learn any activity?
I think that building a universal how - to
I think that building a universal how - to manual would be a tremendous gift for the world.
Knowledge is power and wikiHow has the potential to
Knowledge is power and wikiHow has the potential to make all of us a bit more powerful.
I've I've been interested in building a comprehensive how
I've I've been interested in building a comprehensive how - to manual long before I first envisioned wikiHow.
My first attempt at building this resource was
My first attempt at building this resource was a website I used to run called eHow.
eHow was and continues to be the largest
eHow was and continues to be the largest and how to website in the world.
eHow contains copyrighted content run on proprietary software.
When I ran eHow, the content was professionally produced and edited.
This business model worked for producing content on topics that appeal
This business model worked for producing content on topics that appeal to advertisers in languages like English that have large advertising markets.
However, paying people to write and edit articles ultimately
However, paying people to write and edit articles ultimately means that you have to make one of two sacrifices.
You either 1) sacrifice on breadth and don't do
You either 1) sacrifice on breadth and don't don't produce the topics that won't won't interest advertisers

You either 1) sacrifice on breadth and don't don't produce the topics that won't won't interest advertisers, or 2) you sacrifice on quality and produce content that doesn't doesn't cost much to write.
I wasn't wasn't interested in making
I wasn't wasn't interested in making either of these sacrifices, as I think
I wasn't wasn't interested in making either of these sacrifices, as I think the world's world's how to manual needs to be high quality AND comprehensive.
So ultimately I decided that eHow's eHow's
So ultimately I decided that eHow's eHow's model would not build the resource I envisioned.
When I discovered Wikipedia, I recognized that the wiki model had the
When I discovered Wikipedia, I recognized that the wiki model had the potential to build the how - to resource the world really needs.
So I decided to sell eHow and
So I decided to sell eHow and use the proceeds to build wikiHow.
Why did you decide to use a Creative Commons license?
We use a Creative Commons license to give our
We use a Creative Commons license to give our community the right to fork (http://www.wikihow.com/wikiHow:Right-to-Fork).
In my opinion, people should be hesitant to contribute to
In my opinion, people should be hesitant to contribute to websites where you only have the " right to leave . "
If wikiHow volunteers think our site is
If wikiHow volunteers think our site is going in the wrong direction, they
If wikiHow volunteers think our site is going in the wrong direction, they can take all the content and all the software and move the project elsewhere.
This is possible because we release
This is possible because we release all of our software under the Open
This is possible because we release all of our software under the Open Source GPL license and release our content under a Creative Commons license.
This right to fork guarantees that
This right to fork guarantees that wikiHow, the company, will
This right to fork guarantees that wikiHow, the company, will always serve the goal of the mission and our volunteer community.
I believe that offering this right to fork has
I believe that offering this right to fork has been a key element of our success thus far.
My hope is that over time,
My hope is that over time, internet users will demand this of any
My hope is that over time, internet users will demand this of any site where they invest their time in a way that creates value for others.
That said, when we started out
That said, when we started out I didn't didn't know the difference
That said, when we started out I didn't didn't know the difference between the GNU Free Document License and my California Driver's Driver's license.
As a result, we made some mistakes along the path.
In retrospect, I think we probably should have selected the CC BY
In retrospect, I think we probably should have selected the CC BY - SA license instead of CC - BY - SA - NC.
At a minimum this would provide a helpful
At a minimum this would provide a helpful compatibility with other wikis and free culture projects.
wikiHow now has millions of visitors per month.
How did you grow the site
How did you grow the site to the size it is today?
In December 2008, wikiHow had over 14 million unique visitors
In December 2008, wikiHow had over 14 million unique visitors according to Google Analytics (Full data: http://www.wikihow.com/wikiHow:Statistics).
Quantcast ranks wikiHow as the 135th most popular site in the US.
wikiHow achieved this popularity for a few reasons.
First, people around the world are desperate
First, people around the world are desperate for high quality how - to information.
People want to learn more practical
People want to learn more practical skills, and for the most
People want to learn more practical skills, and for the most part the internet doesn't doesn't provide enough quality information yet.
Second, we attracted millions of readers via the
Second, we attracted millions of readers via the virtuous circle of wiki editing: We had some articles

Second, we attracted millions of readers via the virtuous circle of wiki editing: We had some articles of mixed quality, and editors joined to improve those articles, which in turn attracted more readers.
We continue to depend on this same
We continue to depend on this same virtuous cycle: More readers, means
We continue to depend on this same virtuous cycle: More readers, means more editors, which creates better instructions, leading again to more readers.
It is the same virtuous circle that Wikipedia has enjoyed.
Wikinews interviews academic Simon Ličen about attitudes towards US Paralympics
A Russian stamp for Paralympic Games in Sochi in 2014
On Thursday, with 110 days until the start of the 2014
On Thursday, with 110 days until the start of the 2014 Winter Paralympics in Sochi, Russia, Wikinews interviewed Assistant Professor in

On Thursday, with 110 days until the start of the 2014 Winter Paralympics in Sochi, Russia, Wikinews interviewed Assistant Professor in Educational Leadership, Sport Studies and Educational / Counseling Psychology at Washington State University Simon Ličen about attitudes in United States towards the Paralympics.
Ličen has recently joined the Sport
Ličen has recently joined the Sport Management Program at Washington State University
Ličen has recently joined the Sport Management Program at Washington State University to develop its sport media and communication research and teaching contents.
Originally from Slovenia, he served as
Originally from Slovenia, he served as the Director of Media and Communications of
Originally from Slovenia, he served as the Director of Media and Communications of a WTA Tour event and was a member of the UNESCO Slovenian National Commission.
He was also the Team Manager of
He was also the Team Manager of the Slovenian wheelchair basketball national team.
Why do you think the Paralympic movement
Why do you think the Paralympic movement has so little visibility in the US
Why do you think the Paralympic movement has so little visibility in the US compared to other countries like Australia, the United Kingdom and even Canada?
Sports in the United States largely reaffirm
Sports in the United States largely reaffirm existing relations of power in society.
It emphasizes consumerism, the belief that success always goes
It emphasizes consumerism, the belief that success always goes to people who merit it due to their abilities,

It emphasizes consumerism, the belief that success always goes to people who merit it due to their abilities, dedication and qualifications, and reinforces, rather than changes, existing ideas related to gender, ethnicity and nationality.
Paralympic sport brings attention to athletes who
Paralympic sport brings attention to athletes who are typically overlooked in American society because the
Paralympic sport brings attention to athletes who are typically overlooked in American society because the majority of the population does not want to identify with people who are disabled.
Although disability is not contagious, interest in disabled sports might
Although disability is not contagious, interest in disabled sports might put into question the masculinity of the males following it.
Disabled athletes also challenge existing relations of
Disabled athletes also challenge existing relations of power by displaying dedication, hard work
Disabled athletes also challenge existing relations of power by displaying dedication, hard work and perseverance in different contexts than those most sports fans are accustomed to.
Other countries, including the ones you mention,
Other countries, including the ones you mention, have stronger social orientations in all aspects of society.
Even though legislative support may be less strong
Even though legislative support may be less strong than the one provided by the Americans with Disabilities

Even though legislative support may be less strong than the one provided by the Americans with Disabilities Act, many social institutions including the media are more receptive to this form of diversity.
What do you think the impact will
What do you think the impact will be for the Paralympic movement will be
What do you think the impact will be for the Paralympic movement will be with the Games being televised live in the United States for first time?
The impact depends on a number of aspects.
One of them is the channels
One of them is the channels that NBC as the broadcasting rights owner
One of them is the channels that NBC as the broadcasting rights owner for the United States will use to air the Paralympic Games on.
Will they be shown nationally or regionally, on NBC or
Will they be shown nationally or regionally, on NBC or on any of the company’s company ’s multiple cable networks?
A second aspect is the parts or hours
A second aspect is the parts or hours of the day the Paralympics will be shown.
Remember that there is a nine -
Remember that there is a nine - hour difference between Sochi and New York
Remember that there is a nine - hour difference between Sochi and New York, and a 12 - hour difference between Sochi and the US West Coast.
So daytime events will be shown live in the
So daytime events will be shown live in the United States in the middle of the night,
So daytime events will be shown live in the United States in the middle of the night, and evening prime - time events will be shown — indeed live — in the morning U.S. time.
So showing the Paralympics live on United States television might
So showing the Paralympics live on United States television might turn out to be less glamorous than it appears.
A third important factor is the way
A third important factor is the way the event will be mediated: will NBC
A third important factor is the way the event will be mediated: will NBC have its best sports broadcasters following the event after having worked the Winter Olympics?
Will they treat and announce the competitions as they
Will they treat and announce the competitions as they do all others — for better and worse?
Will they take it as an
Will they take it as an opportunity to educate viewers about disability and
Will they take it as an opportunity to educate viewers about disability and diversity while showing superb athletic performances without engaging in a discourse of pity?
All in all, I think this is a terrific
All in all, I think this is a terrific opportunity to improve sports coverage in a multitude of aspects;

All in all, I think this is a terrific opportunity to improve sports coverage in a multitude of aspects; but we will have to wait until after the event to assess to what extent the broadcasters will meet these expectations.

Stardust is a NASA space capsule that collected
Stardust is a NASA space capsule that collected samples from comet 81P/Wild (also known as "
Stardust is a NASA space capsule that collected samples from comet 81P/Wild (also known as " Wild 2) in deep space and landed back on Earth on January 15, 2006.
It was decided that a collaborative
It was decided that a collaborative online review process would be used
It was decided that a collaborative online review process would be used to " discover " the microscopically small samples the capsule collected.
The project is called Stardust @ home.
Unlike distributed computing projects like SETI @ home,
Unlike distributed computing projects like SETI @ home, Stardust @ home relies entirely on human intelligence.
Andrew Westphal is the director of Stardust @ home.

Wikinews interviewed him for May's May's Interview of the Month (IOTM) on May 18, 2006.

The primary science goal of the mission was to collect a sample from a known primitive solar - system body, a comet called Wild 2 (pronounced " Vilt - two " — the discoverer was German, I believe).
This is the first US " sample return " mission since
This is the first US " sample return " mission since Apollo, and the first ever from beyond the moon.

By " sample return " of course I mean a mission that brings back extraterrestrial material.

I should have said above that this is the first " solid " sample return mission —

basically this is a sample of the Galaxy.

AN OPEN LETTER TO THE PEOPLE OF THE FLOOD AREA
This has been a sad time in my life
This has been a sad time in my life, and in the lives of all of us.
We have lost much--too much, really, to list.
The task that lies ahead--to put Rapid City and
The task that lies ahead--to put Rapid City and the area back together--will not be done for years.
I think of the letter from a
I think of the letter from a lady which said, " It is only
I think of the letter from a lady which said, " It is only as the days pass that we are beginning to realize what we have lost.
Estimates to make our home livable range around
Estimates to make our home livable range around $10,000, and this does not include such
Estimates to make our home livable range around $10,000, and this does not include such items as furniture, antiques, and loving work we have done steadily since buying the house.
Also, we still have approximately $17,100 left on our mortgage.
For a family as young as ours
For a family as young as ours, this is an overwhelming situation . "
Unfortunately, the present Disaster Relief Act does not do the job for
Unfortunately, the present Disaster Relief Act does not do the job for private homeowners and businessmen who saw their property destroyed by the flood.
For those facing this situation all the present law offers is
For those facing this situation all the present law offers is a loan at 5 1/8% interest to try to rebuild.
The best way, and I believe the
The best way, and I believe the fairest way, to help families and businesses
The best way, and I believe the fairest way, to help families and businesses who lost everything in the flood is to give them flat cash grants to rebuild.
I investigated this possibility carefully and found the unanimous feeling that
I investigated this possibility carefully and found the unanimous feeling that legislation to give flat cash grants could never pass the Congress.
I could have introduced a bill to provide grants even
I could have introduced a bill to provide grants even though it could not have passed, but I feel

I could have introduced a bill to provide grants even though it could not have passed, but I feel very strongly that to have done this would have simply raised false hopes where real help is what is needed.
For this reason I decided to introduce legislation
For this reason I decided to introduce legislation that would lower interest rates on rebuilding loans
For this reason I decided to introduce legislation that would lower interest rates on rebuilding loans and provide that a major portion of these loans would not have to be repaid.
Very frankly, winning passage of the entire package of flood
Very frankly, winning passage of the entire package of flood relief bills I have sponsored will be an extremely difficult task.
On the other hand, when these bills were introduced
On the other hand, when these bills were introduced most Congressmen felt that no new legislation could be passed.
As of today, the House has passed one of my bills
As of today, the House has passed one of my bills, and prospects for at least some helpful new legislation are good.
Because it is important that people affected by
Because it is important that people affected by the flood disaster know exactly what new laws
Because it is important that people affected by the flood disaster know exactly what new laws have been proposed, how these would affect them, and what the chances for getting these

Because it is important that people affected by the flood disaster know exactly what new laws have been proposed, how these would affect them, and what the chances for getting these new laws really is, I would like to give you a hard, realistic appraisal of what we are trying to do, and how likely it is that we will succeed.
1. Legislation to lower the interest rate on SBA loans:
SBA loans are presently available to businessmen
SBA loans are presently available to businessmen and homeowners affected by the flood.
The person making the loan must
The person making the loan must repay all but $2,500 of
The person making the loan must repay all but $2,500 of the loan and pay the 5 1/8% interest rate as well.
I introduced a bill to lower the interest
I introduced a bill to lower the interest rate on these loans to 1%.
The House Committee rewrote my bill to provide for
The House Committee rewrote my bill to provide for 3% interest if the person repays the full
The House Committee rewrote my bill to provide for 3% interest if the person repays the full loan, or 1% interest if he chooses to not repay $2,500 of the loan.
The bill then passed the House
The bill then passed the House in this slightly weakened form.
The bill would be retroactive to before the
The bill would be retroactive to before the flood and would permit people who have made SBA
The bill would be retroactive to before the flood and would permit people who have made SBA loans at 5 1/8% interest to renegotiate those loans at the new lower interest rate.
The chances that the Senate will pass
The chances that the Senate will pass this bill this summer are good.
2. Legislation to increase the amount of a
2. Legislation to increase the amount of a loan which does not have to be repaid:
Disaster loans must presently be fully repaid
Disaster loans must presently be fully repaid except for $2,500 which is forgiven.
Thus, if you take a $20,000 loan to
Thus, if you take a $20,000 loan to rebuild, you must repay $17,500 of that loan.
I have introduced a bill which would forgive 90
I have introduced a bill which would forgive 90% of the amount of any disaster loan.
Thus, if this bill passes, a person making a $20,000
Thus, if this bill passes, a person making a $20,000 loan to rebuild would have to repay only $2,000 of that amount.
Again, the provisions of this bill, if it passes, will
Again, the provisions of this bill, if it passes, will be available to people who have made loans under the present law.
This is the bill which we need most badly.
It would provide loans on such generous terms
It would provide loans on such generous terms that nearly everyone could afford to rebuild.
Frankly, this is also the bill
Frankly, this is also the bill which will be most difficult to pass.
The House Public Works Subcommittee will open
The House Public Works Subcommittee will open hearings on this bill in July.
I am hopeful that some legislation increasing
I am hopeful that some legislation increasing the amount of a disaster loan which will
I am hopeful that some legislation increasing the amount of a disaster loan which will not have to be repaid (will be " forgiven ") can pass.
But I would rate the chances of passing
But I would rate the chances of passing my 90% forgiveness bill as poor.
The chances of passing some increases in the amount to
The chances of passing some increases in the amount to be forgiven on a loan are probably fair to good.
3. Legislation to rebuild public recreation areas:
Under the present law all public facilities except recreation
Under the present law all public facilities except recreation areas will be restored by the Federal Government.
I feel that recreation facilities, which are vital to our
I feel that recreation facilities, which are vital to our tourist oriented economy, should also be restored with Federal help.
I have introduced a bill that would permit this restoration.
I would rate chances for its
I would rate chances for its passage as fair to good.
This, then, is the most realistic assessment
This, then, is the most realistic assessment I can give of my legislative efforts to help.
I wish I could be more optimistic, but
I wish I could be more optimistic, but, in fairness, I cannot cannot.
All I can promise is that
All I can promise is that I will push just as hard as
All I can promise is that I will push just as hard as I know how for new laws to help in every way possible.
One way you might help me is
One way you might help me is to look over the laws I have proposed
One way you might help me is to look over the laws I have proposed and write me explaining in detail how they would help you or people you know.
We need specific examples of what these laws
We need specific examples of what these laws would mean to the people of Rapid City.
These examples will be our best argument when
These examples will be our best argument when we go before the Committees and the Congress.
In return for your help I
In return for your help I would like to remind you that
In return for your help I would like to remind you that my job, and that of my office, is to help.
Many of you have already written describing problems you are
Many of you have already written describing problems you are having with Federal agencies as a result of the flood.
I cannot cannot urge you too strongly to let me know whenever
I cannot cannot urge you too strongly to let me know whenever you feel there is anything at all I might do to assist.
You can reach me at: 508 Cannon
You can reach me at: 508 Cannon Office Building, Washington, D.C. 20515.
The things we build--homes, businesses, communities--can
The things we build--homes, businesses, communities--can be destroyed, true, but the human spirit is indomitable.
The people hit by this flood have shown that
The people hit by this flood have shown that spirit, and shown it high and wide.
The movement of the Soviet Union to a market
The movement of the Soviet Union to a market economy will greatly enhance the prosperity of your citizens.
Your economists have learned much from the experience of nations
Your economists have learned much from the experience of nations with economies based in varying degrees on free markets.
Your plans for freely convertible currency, free
Your plans for freely convertible currency, free trade, and enterprises undertaken and managed by individuals

Your plans for freely convertible currency, free trade, and enterprises undertaken and managed by individuals who receive the profit or bear the losses that result from their decisions are all highly commendable.
But there is a danger that
But there is a danger that you will adopt features of our
But there is a danger that you will adopt features of our economies that keep us from being as prosperous as we might be.
In particular, there is a danger that you may follow us
In particular, there is a danger that you may follow us in allowing most of the rent of land to be collected privately.
It is important that the rent of land
It is important that the rent of land be retained as a source of government revenue.
While the governments of developed nations with
While the governments of developed nations with market economies collect some of the rent
While the governments of developed nations with market economies collect some of the rent of land in taxes, they do not collect nearly as much as they could

While the governments of developed nations with market economies collect some of the rent of land in taxes, they do not collect nearly as much as they could, and they therefore make unnecessarily great use of taxes that impede their economies--taxes on such things as incomes, sales and the value of capital.
Social collection of the rent of land
Social collection of the rent of land and natural resources serves three purposes.
First, it guarantees that no one dispossesses fellow citizens by
First, it guarantees that no one dispossesses fellow citizens by obtaining a disproportionate share of what nature provides for humanity.
Second, it provides revenue with which governments
Second, it provides revenue with which governments can pay for socially valuable activities without discouraging capital

Second, it provides revenue with which governments can pay for socially valuable activities without discouraging capital formation or work effort, or interfering in other ways with the efficient allocation of resources.
Third, the resulting revenue permits utility
Third, the resulting revenue permits utility and other services that have marked economies
Third, the resulting revenue permits utility and other services that have marked economies of scale or density to be priced at levels conducive to their efficient use.
The rental value of land arises from three sources.
The first is the inherent natural productivity of land
The first is the inherent natural productivity of land, combined with the fact that land is limited.
The second source of land value is the growth of
The second source of land value is the growth of communities; the third is the provision of public services.
All citizens have equal claims on the component
All citizens have equal claims on the component of land value that arises from nature.
The component of land value that arises from
The component of land value that arises from community growth and provision of services is the most

The component of land value that arises from community growth and provision of services is the most sensible source of revenue for financing public services that raise the rental value of surrounding land.
These services include roads, urban transit networks, parks, and public
These services include roads, urban transit networks, parks, and public utility networks for such services as electricity, telephones, water and sewers.
A public revenue system should strive
A public revenue system should strive to collect as much of the
A public revenue system should strive to collect as much of the rent of land as possible, allocating the part of rent derived

A public revenue system should strive to collect as much of the rent of land as possible, allocating the part of rent derived from nature to all citizens equally, and allocating the part derived from public services to the governmental units that provide those services.
When governments collect the increase in
When governments collect the increase in land value that results from the provision
When governments collect the increase in land value that results from the provision of services, they are able to offer services at prices that represent the

When governments collect the increase in land value that results from the provision of services, they are able to offer services at prices that represent the marginal social cost of these services, promoting efficient use of the services and enhancing the rental value of the land where the services are available.
Government agencies that use land should be charged the same
Government agencies that use land should be charged the same rentals as others for the land they use, or services

Government agencies that use land should be charged the same rentals as others for the land they use, or services will not be adequately financed and agencies will not have adequate incentive or guidance for economizing on their use of land.
Some economists might be tempted to suggest that the rent can
Some economists might be tempted to suggest that the rent can be collected publicly simply by selling land outright at auction.
There are a number of reasons why
There are a number of reasons why this is not a good idea.
First, there is so much land to be
First, there is so much land to be turned over to private management that any effort to
First, there is so much land to be turned over to private management that any effort to dispose of all of it in a short period would result in an extreme depression in prices offered.
Second, some persons who could make excellent use of land
Second, some persons who could make excellent use of land would be unable to raise money for the purchase price.
Collecting rent annually provides access to land
Collecting rent annually provides access to land for persons with limited access to credit.
Third, subsequent resale of land would
Third, subsequent resale of land would enable speculators to make large profits unrelated
Third, subsequent resale of land would enable speculators to make large profits unrelated to any productive services they offer, resulting in needless inequity and dissatisfaction.
Fourth, concern about future political conditions would tend to depress offers.
Collecting rent annually permits the citizens of future years
Collecting rent annually permits the citizens of future years to capture the benefits of good future public policies.
Fifth, because investors tend to be averse to risk,
Fifth, because investors tend to be averse to risk, general uncertainty about the future will tend to depress offers.
This risk aversion is sidestepped by allowing future
This risk aversion is sidestepped by allowing future rental payments to be determined by future conditions.
Finally, the future rent of land can more justly be
Finally, the future rent of land can more justly be claimed by future generations than by today's today's citizens.
Requiring annual payments from the users of land allows each year's
Requiring annual payments from the users of land allows each year's year's population to claim that year's year's rent.
While the proceeds of sales could be
While the proceeds of sales could be invested for the benefit of future generations,
While the proceeds of sales could be invested for the benefit of future generations, not collecting the money in advance guarantees the heritage of the future against political excesses.
The attached Appendix provides a brief technical
The attached Appendix provides a brief technical discussion of issues of the duration of
The attached Appendix provides a brief technical discussion of issues of the duration of rights to use land, the transfer of land, the assessment of land

The attached Appendix provides a brief technical discussion of issues of the duration of rights to use land, the transfer of land, the assessment of land, social protection against the abuse and subsequent abandonment of run - down property, and redistribution among localities to adjust for differences in natural per capita endowments.
While these issues need to be addressed,
While these issues need to be addressed, none of them present any insoluble problems.
A balance should be kept between allowing the managers of
A balance should be kept between allowing the managers of property to retain value derived from their own efforts to

A balance should be kept between allowing the managers of property to retain value derived from their own efforts to maintain and improve property, and securing for public use the naturally inherent and socially created value of land.
Users of land should not be allowed to
Users of land should not be allowed to acquire rights of indefinite duration for single payments.
For efficiency, for adequate revenue and for justice, every
For efficiency, for adequate revenue and for justice, every user of land should be required to make an annual payment

For efficiency, for adequate revenue and for justice, every user of land should be required to make an annual payment to the local government, equal to the current rental value of the land that he or she prevents others from using.

Long years ago we made a tryst with

At the stroke of the midnight hour, when the
At the stroke of the midnight hour, when the world sleeps, India will awake to life and freedom.

It is fitting that at this solemn moment, we take the pledge of dedication to the service of India and her people and to the still larger cause of humanity.

At the dawn of history, India started on her unending quest, and trackless centuries are filled with her striving and grandeur of her success and failures.

Through good and ill fortune alike, she has never lost sight of that quest, forgotten the ideals which gave her strength.
We end today a period of
We end today a period of misfortunes and India discovers herself again.

The achievement we celebrate today is but a step, an opening of opportunity to the greater triumphs and achievements that await us.

Are we brave enough and wise enough to grasp this opportunity and accept the challenge of the future?

The responsibility rests upon this Assembly, a sovereign body representing the sovereign people of India.

Before the birth of freedom, we have endured all the pains of labour and our hearts are heavy with the memory of this sorrrow.

That future is not one of ease or resting but of incessant striving so that we
That future is not one of ease or resting but of incessant striving so that we may fulfill the pledges we have so often taken and the one we shall take today.
The service of India means, the
The service of India means, the service of the millions who suffer.
It means the ending of poverty and ignorance
It means the ending of poverty and ignorance and poverty and disease and inequality of opportunity.

The ambition of the greatest men of our generation has been to wipe every tear from every eye.
That may be beyond us, but as long as there are
That may be beyond us, but as long as there are tears and suffering, so long our work will not be over.

And so we have to labour and to work, and to work hard, to give reality to our dreams.

Those dreams are for India, but they are also for the world, for all the nations and peoples are too closely knit together today for any one of them to imagine that it can live apart.

We have to build the noble mansion of
We have to build the noble mansion of free India where all her children may dwell.

The appointed day has come - the day appointed by destiny - and India stands forth again, after long slumber and struggle, awake, vital, free and independent.

The past clings on to us still in some measure and we have to do much before we redeem the pledges we have so often taken.

Yet the turning - point is past, and history begins anew for us, the history which we shall live and act and others will write about.

It is a fateful moment for us in India, for all Asia and for the world.

A new star rises, the star of freedom in the East, a new hope comes into being, a vision long cherished materializes.

May the star never set and that hope never be betrayed!

We rejoice in that freedom, even though clouds surround us, and many of our people are sorrowstricken and difficult problems encompass us.

But freedom brings responsibilities and burdens and we have to face them in the spirit of a free and disciplined people.

We shall never allow that torch of freedom to be blown out, however high the wind or stormy the tempest.

We think also of our brothers and sisters who have been cut off from us by political boundaries and who unhappily cannot share at present in the freedom that has come.

They are of us and will remain of us whatever may happen, and
They are of us and will remain of us whatever may happen, and we shall be sharers in their good [or] ill fortune alike.

To bring freedom and opportunity to the
To bring freedom and opportunity to the common man, to the peasants and workers

To bring freedom and opportunity to the common man, to the peasants and workers of India; to fight and end poverty and ignorance and disease; to build up a prosperous, democratic and progressive nation, and to create social, economic and political institutions which will ensure justice and fullness of life to every man and woman.
There is no resting for any one of
There is no resting for any one of us till we redeem our pledge in full
There is no resting for any one of us till we redeem our pledge in full, till we make all the people of India what destiny intended them to be.
We are citizens of a great
We are citizens of a great country on the verge of bold
We are citizens of a great country on the verge of bold advance, and we have to live up to that high standard.
All of us, to whatever religion we may belong, are
All of us, to whatever religion we may belong, are equally the children of India with equal rights, privileges and obligations.
We cannot cannot encourage communalism or narrow - mindedness, for no
We cannot cannot encourage communalism or narrow - mindedness, for no nation can be great whose people are narrow in thought or in action.
To the nations and peoples of
To the nations and peoples of the world we send greetings and pledge
To the nations and peoples of the world we send greetings and pledge ourselves to cooperate with them in furthering peace, freedom and democracy.
And to India, our much - loved
And to India, our much - loved motherland, the ancient, the eternal and the
And to India, our much - loved motherland, the ancient, the eternal and the ever - new, we pay our reverent homage and we bind ourselves afresh to her service.

Announcing Decision To Resign the Office of President of the United States

In the past few days, however, it has become evident to me that I
In the past few days, however, it has become evident to me that I no longer have a strong enough political base in the Congress to justify continuing that effort.

But with the disappearance of that base, I now believe that the constitutional purpose has
But with the disappearance of that base, I now believe that the constitutional purpose has been served, and there is no longer a need for the process to be prolonged.

But the interests of the Nation must always come before any personal considerations.

From the discussions I have had with Congressional and other leaders, I have concluded that because of the Watergate matter, I might not have the support of the Congress that I would consider necessary to back the very difficult decisions and carry out the duties of this office in the way the interests of the Nation will require.

To leave office before my term is completed is abhorrent to every instinct in my body.

To continue to fight through the months ahead for my personal vindication would almost totally absorb the time and attention of both the President and the Congress in a period when our entire focus should be on the great issues of peace abroad and prosperity without inflation at home.

Today, in many ways, the world looks very different, and the revolutionary change of pace is even more rapid than it has been in the past.

I said, first of all, that I believed in America where work was available to those who were willing and able to work, where the waste of idle men and machines could be avoided, and where greater economic growth could provide the new jobs and the new markets that our growing Nation needed.
That goal has not been fully achieved.
There are still too many men and women, particularly
There are still too many men and women, particularly young men and women, unable to find work.

The rate of unemployment and idle capacity

It is well within our reach.

Most American settlers were from southern states, and many had brought slaves with them.

Mexico tried to accommodate them by maintaining the fiction that the slaves were indentured servants.
But American slaveholders in Texas distrusted the Mexican government and
But American slaveholders in Texas distrusted the Mexican government and wanted Texas to be a new U.S. slave state.
The dislike of most for Roman Catholicism (the
The dislike of most for Roman Catholicism (the prevailing religion of Mexico) and a widely held

The dislike of most for Roman Catholicism (the prevailing religion of Mexico) and a widely held belief in American racial superiority led them generally to regard Mexicans as dishonest, ignorant, and backward.
This 1833 map shows the extent of land grants
This 1833 map shows the extent of land grants made by Mexico to American settlers in Texas.
Nearly all are in the eastern portion of the state,
Nearly all are in the eastern portion of the state, one factor that led to war with Mexico in 1846.

Belief in their own superiority inspired some Texans to try to undermine the power of the Mexican government.
When empresario Haden Edwards attempted to evict

When empresario Haden Edwards attempted to evict people who had settled his land grant before he gained title to it, the Mexican government nullified its agreement with him.
Outraged, Edwards and a small party of
Outraged, Edwards and a small party of men took prisoner the alcalde of Nacogdoches.

The Mexican army marched to the town, and Edwards and his troops then declared the formation of the Republic of Fredonia between the Sabine and Rio Grande Rivers.
To demonstrate loyalty to their adopted country, a force led
To demonstrate loyalty to their adopted country, a force led by Stephen Austin hastened to Nacogdoches to support the Mexican army.

The growing presence of American settlers in
The growing presence of American settlers in Texas, their reluctance to abide by Mexican
The growing presence of American settlers in Texas, their reluctance to abide by Mexican law, and their desire for independence caused the Mexican government to grow wary.
In 1830, it forbade future U.S. immigration
In 1830, it forbade future U.S. immigration and increased its military presence in Texas.
Settlers continued to stream illegally across
Settlers continued to stream illegally across the long border; by 1835,
Settlers continued to stream illegally across the long border; by 1835, after immigration resumed, there were twenty thousand Anglo - Americans in Texas.

Fifty - five delegates from the Anglo - American settlements gathered in 1831 to demand the suspension of customs duties, the resumption of immigration from the United

Fifty - five delegates from the Anglo - American settlements gathered in 1831 to demand the suspension of customs duties, the resumption of immigration from the United States, better protection from Indian tribes, the granting of promised land titles, and the creation of an independent state of Texas separate from Coahuila.
Ordered to disband, the delegates reconvened in early April
Ordered to disband, the delegates reconvened in early April 1833 to write a constitution for an independent Texas.

Surprisingly, General Antonio Lopez de Santa Anna, Mexico’s Mexico ’s new president, agreed to all demands, except the call for statehood.
Coahuila y Texas made provisions for

Coahuila y Texas made provisions for jury trials, increased Texas’s Texas ’s representation in the state legislature, and removed restrictions on commerce.
This portrait of General Antonio Lopez de Santa Anna depicts
This portrait of General Antonio Lopez de Santa Anna depicts the Mexican president and general in full military regalia.
Texans' Texans' hopes for independence were quashed

Texans' Texans' hopes for independence were quashed in 1834, however, when Santa Anna dismissed the Mexican Congress and abolished all state governments, including that of Coahuila y Texas.
In January 1835, reneging on earlier promises, he dispatched
In January 1835, reneging on earlier promises, he dispatched troops to the town of Anahuac to collect customs duties.

Lawyer and soldier William B. Travis and a small force marched on Anahuac in June, and the fort surrendered.

On October 2, Anglo - American forces met Mexican troops at the town of Gonzales; the Mexican troops fled and the Americans moved on to take San Antonio.
Now more cautious, delegates to the Consultation of 1835 at

Now more cautious, delegates to the Consultation of 1835 at San Felipe de Austin voted against declaring independence, instead drafting a statement, which became known as the Declaration of Causes, promising continued loyalty if Mexico returned to a constitutional form of government.

They selected Henry Smith, leader of the Independence Party, as governor of Texas and placed Sam Houston, a former soldier who had been a congressman and governor of Tennessee, in charge of its small military force.

They declared their independence from Mexico and drafted a constitution calling for an American - style judicial system and an elected president and legislature.

Significantly, they also established that slavery would not be prohibited in Texas.

Many wealthy Tejanos supported the push for independence, hoping for liberal governmental reforms and economic benefits.
Mexico had no intention of losing its northern province.
Santa Anna and his army of four thousand
Santa Anna and his army of four thousand had besieged San Antonio in February 1836.
Hopelessly outnumbered, its two hundred defenders, under Travis, fought
Hopelessly outnumbered, its two hundred defenders, under Travis, fought fiercely from their refuge in an old mission known as the Alamo.
After ten days, however, the mission was taken
After ten days, however, the mission was taken and all but a few of the defenders were dead
After ten days, however, the mission was taken and all but a few of the defenders were dead, including Travis and James Bowie, the famed frontiersman who was also a land speculator and slave trader.
A few male survivors, possibly including the frontier legend and former
A few male survivors, possibly including the frontier legend and former Tennessee congressman Davy Crockett, were led outside the walls and executed.
The few women and children inside the mission
The few women and children inside the mission were allowed to leave with the only adult
The few women and children inside the mission were allowed to leave with the only adult male survivor, a slave owned by Travis who was then freed by the Mexican Army.

The Fall of the Alamo, painted by Theodore Gentilz fewer than ten years after this pivotal moment in the Texas Revolution, depicts the 1836 assault on the Alamo complex.

Imagine then that the instructor simply stands there after that announcement, blinking calmly as the class erupts in protest.

The instructor announces, “ I’ve I ’ve decided that you’re you ’re all a bunch of failures and I’m I ’m flunking the entire class . ”
